subject: Re: [junit] Should I ever catch unwanted Exceptions inside my tests?
msgSnippet: ... If you were going to handle it, what would you do that s different from what JUnit already does? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Espen Ã˜. Pedersen wrote:
>
> What actually is good practice:
>
> Keep the test methods clean and let the testXXX method throw the
> Exception to JUnit and let junit report an error.
> (unless you are testing expected Exceptions of course)
>
> Or Catch the Exception inside the test and handle it somehow?

If you were going to handle it, what would you do that's different from
what JUnit already does?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
